     294             : //*****************************************************************************
     295             : // <a ping> support
     296             : //*****************************************************************************
     297             : 
     298             : #define PREF_PINGS_ENABLED           "browser.send_pings"
     299             : #define PREF_PINGS_MAX_PER_LINK      "browser.send_pings.max_per_link"
     300             : #define PREF_PINGS_REQUIRE_SAME_HOST "browser.send_pings.require_same_host"
     301             : 
     302             : // Check prefs to see if pings are enabled and if so what restrictions might
     303             : // be applied.
     304             : //
     305             : // @param maxPerLink
     306             : //   This parameter returns the number of pings that are allowed per link click
     307             : //
     308             : // @param requireSameHost
     309             : //   This parameter returns true if pings are restricted to the same host as
     310             : //   the document in which the click occurs.  If the same host restriction is
     311             : //   imposed, then we still allow for pings to cross over to different
     312             : //   protocols and ports for flexibility and because it is not possible to send
     313             : //   a ping via FTP.
     314             : //
     315             : // @returns
     316             : //   true if pings are enabled and false otherwise.
     317             : //
     318             : static bool
     319           1 : PingsEnabled(int32_t* aMaxPerLink, bool* aRequireSameHost)
     320             : {
     321           1 :   bool allow = Preferences::GetBool(PREF_PINGS_ENABLED, false);
     322             : 
     323           1 :   *aMaxPerLink = 1;
     324           1 :   *aRequireSameHost = true;
     325             : 
     326           1 :   if (allow) {
     327           1 :     Preferences::GetInt(PREF_PINGS_MAX_PER_LINK, aMaxPerLink);
     328           1 :     Preferences::GetBool(PREF_PINGS_REQUIRE_SAME_HOST, aRequireSameHost);
     329             :   }
     330             : 
     331           1 :   return allow;
     332             : }

     352             :

     356           1 :     return;
     357             :   }

     392           1 :     if (!isDataScheme) {

     395             :   }

     508             : static void

     510             :          nsIIOService* aIOService)
     511             : {
     512           1 :   SendPingInfo* info = static_cast<SendPingInfo*>(aClosure);
     513           1 :   if (info->maxPings > -1 && info->numPings >= info->maxPings) {
     514           0 :     return;
     515             :   }
     516             : 
     517           1 :   nsIDocument* doc = aContent->OwnerDoc();
     518             : 
     519             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIChannel> chan;
     520             :   NS_NewChannel(getter_AddRefs(chan),
     521             :                 aURI,
     522             :                 doc,
     523             :                 info->requireSameHost
     524             :                   ? nsILoadInfo::SEC_REQUIRE_SAME_ORIGIN_DATA_IS_BLOCKED
     525             :                   : nsILoadInfo::SEC_ALLOW_CROSS_ORIGIN_DATA_IS_NULL,
     526             :                 nsIContentPolicy::TYPE_PING,
     527             :                 nullptr, // aLoadGroup
     528             :                 nullptr, // aCallbacks
     529             :                 nsIRequest::LOAD_NORMAL, // aLoadFlags,
     530           1 :                 aIOService);
     531             : 
     532           1 :   if (!chan) {
     533             :     return;
     534             :   }
     535             : 
     536             :   // Don't bother caching the result of this URI load, but do not exempt
     537             :   // it from Safe Browsing.
     538           1 :   chan->SetLoadFlags(nsIRequest::INHIBIT_CACHING | nsIChannel::LOAD_CLASSIFY_URI);
     539             : 
     540           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIHttpChannel> httpChan = do_QueryInterface(chan);
     541           1 :   if (!httpChan) {
     542             :     return;
     543             :   }
     544             : 
     545             :   // This is needed in order for 3rd-party cookie blocking to work.

     684             : static nsDOMNavigationTiming::Type
     685           1 : ConvertLoadTypeToNavigationType(uint32_t aLoadType)
     686             : {
     687             :   // Not initialized, assume it's normal load.
     688           1 :   if (aLoadType == 0) {
     689           1 :     aLoadType = LOAD_NORMAL;
     690             :   }
     691             : 
     692           1 :   auto result = nsDOMNavigationTiming::TYPE_RESERVED;

     694             :     case LOAD_NORMAL:
     695             :     case LOAD_NORMAL_EXTERNAL:
     696             :     case LOAD_NORMAL_BYPASS_CACHE:
     697             :     case LOAD_NORMAL_BYPASS_PROXY:
     698             :     case LOAD_NORMAL_BYPASS_PROXY_AND_CACHE:
     699             :     case LOAD_NORMAL_REPLACE:
     700             :     case LOAD_NORMAL_ALLOW_MIXED_CONTENT:
     701             :     case LOAD_LINK:
     702             :     case LOAD_STOP_CONTENT:
     703             :     case LOAD_REPLACE_BYPASS_CACHE:
     704             :       result = nsDOMNavigationTiming::TYPE_NAVIGATE;
     705             :       break;
     706             :     case LOAD_HISTORY:
     707           1 :       result = nsDOMNavigationTiming::TYPE_BACK_FORWARD;
     708           1 :       break;
     709             :     case LOAD_RELOAD_NORMAL:
     710             :     case LOAD_RELOAD_CHARSET_CHANGE:
     711             :     case LOAD_RELOAD_BYPASS_CACHE:
     712             :     case LOAD_RELOAD_BYPASS_PROXY:
     713             :     case LOAD_RELOAD_BYPASS_PROXY_AND_CACHE:
     714             :     case LOAD_RELOAD_ALLOW_MIXED_CONTENT:
     715           1 :       result = nsDOMNavigationTiming::TYPE_RELOAD;
     716           1 :       break;
     717             :     case LOAD_STOP_CONTENT_AND_REPLACE:
     718             :     case LOAD_REFRESH:
     719             :     case LOAD_BYPASS_HISTORY:
     720             :     case LOAD_ERROR_PAGE:
     721             :     case LOAD_PUSHSTATE:
     722           1 :       result = nsDOMNavigationTiming::TYPE_RESERVED;
     723           1 :       break;
     724             :     default:
     725             :       // NS_NOTREACHED("Unexpected load type value");
     726           0 :       result = nsDOMNavigationTiming::TYPE_RESERVED;
     727           0 :       break;
     728             :   }
     729             : 
     730           1 :   return result;

    1253           1 : nsDocShell::LoadURI(nsIURI* aURI,

    1366             :         // By default the subframe will inherit the parent's loadType.

    1373             :           // in the onLoadHandler. We don't want this url to get into session
    1374             :           // history. Clear off shEntry, and set load type to
    1375             :           // LOAD_BYPASS_HISTORY.
    1376           0 :           bool inOnLoadHandler = false;
    1377           0 :           parentDS->GetIsExecutingOnLoadHandler(&inOnLoadHandler);

    1379           0 :             loadType = LOAD_NORMAL_REPLACE;
    1380           0 :             shEntry = nullptr;
    1381             :           }
    1382           1 :         } else if (parentLoadType == LOAD_REFRESH) {
    1383             :           // Clear shEntry. For refresh loads, we have to load
    1384             :           // what comes thro' the pipe, not what's in history.
    1385           0 :           shEntry = nullptr;

    1388           1 :                     ((parentLoadType & LOAD_CMD_HISTORY) ||

    1395             :           loadType = parentLoadType;
    1396           1 :         } else if (parentLoadType == LOAD_ERROR_PAGE) {
    1397             :           // If the parent document is an error page, we don't

    1400             :           loadType = LOAD_BYPASS_HISTORY;
    1401           1 :         } else if ((parentLoadType == LOAD_RELOAD_BYPASS_CACHE) ||

    1404             :           // the new frame should inherit the parent's load type so that it also
    1405             :           // bypasses the cache and/or proxy
    1406           1 :           loadType = parentLoadType;
    1407             :         }
    1408             :       } else {
    1409             :         // This is a pre-existing subframe. If the load was not originally
    1410             :         // initiated by session history, (if (!shEntry) condition succeeded) and
    1411             :         // mCurrentURI is not null, it is possible that a parent's onLoadHandler
    1412             :         // or even self's onLoadHandler is loading a new page in this child.
    1413             :         // Check parent's and self's busy flag  and if it is set, we don't want
    1414             :         // this onLoadHandler load to get in to session history.
    1415           1 :         uint32_t parentBusy = BUSY_FLAGS_NONE;
    1416           1 :         uint32_t selfBusy = BUSY_FLAGS_NONE;
    1417           1 :         parentDS->GetBusyFlags(&parentBusy);
    1418             :         GetBusyFlags(&selfBusy);
    1419           1 :         if (parentBusy & BUSY_FLAGS_BUSY ||
    1420           1 :             selfBusy & BUSY_FLAGS_BUSY) {
    1421           1 :           loadType = LOAD_NORMAL_REPLACE;
    1422           1 :           shEntry = nullptr;
    1423             :         }
    1424             :       }
    1425             :     } // parentDS
    1426             :     else {
    1427             :       // This is the root docshell. If we got here while
    1428             :       // executing an onLoad Handler,this load will not go
    1429             :       // into session history.
    1430           1 :       bool inOnLoadHandler = false;
    1431             :       GetIsExecutingOnLoadHandler(&inOnLoadHandler);
    1432           1 :       if (inOnLoadHandler) {
    1433           1 :         loadType = LOAD_NORMAL_REPLACE;
    1434             :       }
    1435             :     }
    1436             :   } // !shEntry
    1437             : 
    1438           1 :   if (shEntry) {
    1439             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1440             :     MOZ_LOG(gDocShellLog, LogLevel::Debug,
    1441             :            ("nsDocShell[%p]: loading from session history", this));
    1442             : #endif
    1443             : 
    1444           1 :     return LoadHistoryEntry(shEntry, loadType);
    1445             :   }
    1446             : 
    1447             :   // On history navigation via Back/Forward buttons, don't execute
    1448             :   // automatic JavaScript redirection such as |location.href = ...| or
    1449             :   // |window.open()|
    1450             :   //
    1451             :   // LOAD_NORMAL:        window.open(...) etc.
    1452             :   // LOAD_STOP_CONTENT:  location.href = ..., location.assign(...)
    1453           1 :   if ((loadType == LOAD_NORMAL || loadType == LOAD_STOP_CONTENT) &&
    1454           1 :       ShouldBlockLoadingForBackButton()) {
    1455             :     return NS_OK;
    1456             :   }
    1457             : 
    1458             :   // Perform the load...
    1459             : 
    1460             :   // We need a principalToInherit.
    1461             :   //
    1462             :   // If principalIsExplicit is not set there are 4 possibilities:
    1463             :   // (1) If the system principal or an expanded principal was passed
    1464             :   //     in and we're a typeContent docshell, inherit the principal
    1465             :   //     from the current document instead.
    1466             :   // (2) In all other cases when the principal passed in is not null,
    1467             :   //     use that principal.
    1468             :   // (3) If the caller has allowed inheriting from the current document,
    1469             :   //     or if we're being called from system code (eg chrome JS or pure
    1470             :   //     C++) then inheritPrincipal should be true and InternalLoad will get
    1471             :   //     a principal from the current document. If none of these things are
    1472             :   //     true, then
    1473             :   // (4) we don't pass a principal into the channel, and a principal will be
    1474             :   //     created later from the channel's internal data.
    1475             :   //
    1476             :   // If principalIsExplicit *is* set, there are 4 possibilities
    1477             :   // (1) If the system principal or an expanded principal was passed in
    1478             :   //     and we're a typeContent docshell, return an error.
    1479             :   // (2) In all other cases when the principal passed in is not null,
    1480             :   //     use that principal.
    1481             :   // (3) If the caller has allowed inheriting from the current document,
    1482             :   //     then inheritPrincipal should be true and InternalLoad will get
    1483             :   //     a principal from the current document. If none of these things are
    1484             :   //     true, then
    1485             :   // (4) we dont' pass a principal into the channel, and a principal will be
    1486             :   //     created later from the channel's internal data.
    1487           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIPrincipal> principalToInherit = triggeringPrincipal;
    1488           1 :   if (principalToInherit && mItemType != typeChrome) {
    1489           1 :     if (nsContentUtils::IsSystemPrincipal(principalToInherit)) {
    1490           1 :       if (principalIsExplicit) {
    1491             :         return NS_ERROR_DOM_SECURITY_ERR;
    1492             :       }
    1493           1 :       principalToInherit = nullptr;
    1494           1 :       inheritPrincipal = true;
    1495           1 :     } else if (nsContentUtils::IsExpandedPrincipal(principalToInherit)) {
    1496           1 :       if (principalIsExplicit) {
    1497             :         return NS_ERROR_DOM_SECURITY_ERR;
    1498             :       }
    1499             :       // Don't inherit from the current page.  Just do the safe thing
    1500             :       // and pretend that we were loaded by a nullprincipal.
    1501             :       //
    1502             :       // We didn't inherit OriginAttributes here as ExpandedPrincipal doesn't
    1503             :       // have origin attributes.
    1504           1 :       principalToInherit = NullPrincipal::CreateWithInheritedAttributes(this);
    1505           1 :       inheritPrincipal = false;
    1506             :     }
    1507             :   }
    1508           1 :   if (!principalToInherit && !inheritPrincipal && !principalIsExplicit) {
    1509             :     // See if there's system or chrome JS code running
    1510           1 :     inheritPrincipal = nsContentUtils::LegacyIsCallerChromeOrNativeCode();
    1511             :   }
    1512             : 
    1513           1 :   if (aLoadFlags & LOAD_FLAGS_DISALLOW_INHERIT_PRINCIPAL) {
    1514           1 :     inheritPrincipal = false;
    1515             :     // If aFirstParty is true and the pref 'privacy.firstparty.isolate' is
    1516             :     // enabled, we will set firstPartyDomain on the origin attributes.
    1517           1 :     principalToInherit = NullPrincipal::CreateWithInheritedAttributes(this, aFirstParty);
    1518             :   }
    1519             : 
    1520             :   // If the triggeringPrincipal is not passed explicitly, we first try to create
    1521             :   // a principal from the referrer, since the referrer URI reflects the web origin
    1522             :   // that triggered the load. If there is no referrer URI, we fall back to using
    1523             :   // the SystemPrincipal. It's safe to assume that no provided triggeringPrincipal
    1524             :   // and no referrer simulate a load that was triggered by the system.
    1525             :   // It's important to note that this block of code needs to appear *after* the block
    1526             :   // where we munge the principalToInherit, because otherwise we would never enter
    1527             :   // code blocks checking if the principalToInherit is null and we will end up with
    1528             :   // a wrong inheritPrincipal flag.
    1529           1 :   if (!triggeringPrincipal) {
    1530           1 :     if (referrer) {
    1531             :       nsresult rv = CreatePrincipalFromReferrer(referrer,
    1532           1 :                                                 getter_AddRefs(triggeringPrincipal));
    1533           1 :       NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, rv);
    1534             :     }
    1535             :     else {
    1536           1 :       triggeringPrincipal = nsContentUtils::GetSystemPrincipal();
    1537             :     }
    1538             :   }
    1539             : 
    1540           1 :   uint32_t flags = 0;
    1541             : 
    1542           1 :   if (inheritPrincipal) {
    1543           1 :     flags |= INTERNAL_LOAD_FLAGS_INHERIT_PRINCIPAL;
    1544             :   }
    1545             : 
    1546           1 :   if (!sendReferrer) {
    1547           1 :     flags |= INTERNAL_LOAD_FLAGS_DONT_SEND_REFERRER;
    1548             :   }
    1549             : 
    1550           1 :   if (aLoadFlags & LOAD_FLAGS_ALLOW_THIRD_PARTY_FIXUP) {
    1551           1 :     flags |= INTERNAL_LOAD_FLAGS_ALLOW_THIRD_PARTY_FIXUP;
    1552             :   }
    1553             : 
    1554           1 :   if (aLoadFlags & LOAD_FLAGS_FIRST_LOAD) {
    1555           1 :     flags |= INTERNAL_LOAD_FLAGS_FIRST_LOAD;
    1556             :   }
    1557             : 
    1558           1 :   if (aLoadFlags & LOAD_FLAGS_BYPASS_CLASSIFIER) {
    1559           1 :     flags |= INTERNAL_LOAD_FLAGS_BYPASS_CLASSIFIER;
    1560             :   }
    1561             : 
    1562           1 :   if (aLoadFlags & LOAD_FLAGS_FORCE_ALLOW_COOKIES) {
    1563           0 :     flags |= INTERNAL_LOAD_FLAGS_FORCE_ALLOW_COOKIES;
    1564             :   }
    1565             : 
    1566           1 :   if (isSrcdoc) {
    1567           1 :     flags |= INTERNAL_LOAD_FLAGS_IS_SRCDOC;
    1568             :   }
    1569             : 
    1570             :   return InternalLoad(aURI,
    1571             :                       originalURI,
    1572             :                       loadReplace,
    1573             :                       referrer,
    1574             :                       referrerPolicy,
    1575             :                       triggeringPrincipal,
    1576             :                       principalToInherit,
    1577             :                       flags,
    1578             :                       target,
    1579             :                       nullptr,      // No type hint
    1580           1 :                       NullString(), // No forced download
    1581             :                       postStream,
    1582             :                       headersStream,
    1583             :                       loadType,
    1584             :                       nullptr, // No SHEntry
    1585             :                       aFirstParty,
    1586             :                       srcdoc,
    1587             :                       sourceDocShell,
    1588             :                       baseURI,
    1589             :                       false,
    1590             :                       nullptr,  // No nsIDocShell
    1591           1 :                       nullptr); // No nsIRequest
    1592             : }
    1593             :

    1809             : 
    1810             : //
    1811             : // Bug 13871: Prevent frameset spoofing
    1812             : //
    1813             : // This routine answers: 'Is origin's document from same domain as
    1814             : // target's document?'
    1815             : //
    1816             : // file: uris are considered the same domain for the purpose of
    1817             : // frame navigation regardless of script accessibility (bug 420425)
    1818             : //
    1819             : /* static */ bool
    1820           1 : nsDocShell::ValidateOrigin(nsIDocShellTreeItem* aOriginTreeItem,

    1824             :   // JS on the stack. System callers still need to do it.

    1826           1 :       nsContentUtils::IsCallerChrome()) {

    1828             :   }

    1835             :

    1844             :     return true;
    1845             :   }

    2608           1 :   NS_ENSURE_ARG_POINTER(aFullscreenAllowed);
    2609             : 
    2610             :   // Browsers and apps have their mFullscreenAllowed retrieved from their
    2611             :   // corresponding iframe in their parent upon creation.
    2612           1 :   if (mFullscreenAllowed != CHECK_ATTRIBUTES) {
    2613           0 :     *aFullscreenAllowed = (mFullscreenAllowed == PARENT_ALLOWS);
    2614           0 :     return NS_OK;
    2615             :   }
    2616             : 
    2617             :   // Assume false until we determine otherwise...
    2618           1 :   *aFullscreenAllowed = false;
    2619             : 
    2620           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter> win = GetWindow();
    2621           1 :   if (!win) {
    2622             :     return NS_OK;
    2623             :   }
    2624           1 :   if (nsCOMPtr<Element> frameElement = win->GetFrameElementInternal()) {
    2625           1 :     if (frameElement->IsXULElement()) {
    2626           1 :       if (frameElement->HasAttr(kNameSpaceID_None,
    2627           1 :                                 nsGkAtoms::disablefullscreen)) {
    2628             :         // Document inside this frame is explicitly disabled.
    2629             :         return NS_OK;
    2630             :       }
    2631             :     } else {
    2632             :       // We do not allow document inside any containing element other
    2633             :       // than iframe to enter fullscreen.
    2634           1 :       if (frameElement->IsHTMLElement(nsGkAtoms::iframe)) {
    2635             :         // If any ancestor iframe does not have allowfullscreen attribute
    2636             :         // set, then fullscreen is not allowed.
    2637           1 :         if (!frameElement->HasAttr(kNameSpaceID_None,
    2638           1 :                                   nsGkAtoms::allowfullscreen) &&
    2639             :             !frameElement->HasAttr(kNameSpaceID_None,
    2640           1 :                                   nsGkAtoms::mozallowfullscreen)) {
    2641             :           return NS_OK;
    2642             :         }
    2643           1 :       } else if (frameElement->IsHTMLElement(nsGkAtoms::embed)) {
    2644             :         // Respect allowfullscreen only if this is a rewritten YouTube embed.
    2645             :         nsCOMPtr<nsIObjectLoadingContent> objectLoadingContent =
    2646           1 :           do_QueryInterface(frameElement);
    2647           1 :         if (!objectLoadingContent) {
    2648             :           return NS_OK;
    2649             :         }
    2650             :         nsObjectLoadingContent* olc =
    2651           1 :           static_cast<nsObjectLoadingContent*>(objectLoadingContent.get());
    2652           1 :         if (!olc->IsRewrittenYoutubeEmbed()) {
    2653             :           return NS_OK;
    2654             :         }
    2655             :         // We don't have to check prefixed attributes because Flash does not
    2656             :         // support them.
    2657           1 :         if (!frameElement->HasAttr(kNameSpaceID_None,
    2658           1 :                                   nsGkAtoms::allowfullscreen)) {
    2659             :           return NS_OK;
    2660             :         }

    2662             :         // neither iframe nor embed
    2663             :         return NS_OK;
    2664             :       }
    2665             :     }
    2666             :   }

    2915           1 : nsDocShell::HistoryPurged(int32_t aNumEntries)
    2916             : {
    2917             :   // These indices are used for fastback cache eviction, to determine
    2918             :   // which session history entries are candidates for content viewer
    2919             :   // eviction.  We need to adjust by the number of entries that we
    2920             :   // just purged from history, so that we look at the right session history
    2921             :   // entries during eviction.
    2922           1 :   mPreviousTransIndex = std::max(-1, mPreviousTransIndex - aNumEntries);
    2923           1 :   mLoadedTransIndex = std::max(0, mLoadedTransIndex - aNumEntries);
    2924             : 
    2925           1 :   nsTObserverArray<nsDocLoader*>::ForwardIterator iter(mChildList);
    2926           1 :   while (iter.HasMore()) {
    2927           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> shell = do_QueryObject(iter.GetNext());
    2928           1 :     if (shell) {
    2929           1 :       shell->HistoryPurged(aNumEntries);
    2930             :     }
    2931             :   }
    2932             : 
    2933           1 :   return NS_OK;
    2934             : }
    2935             : 
    2936             : nsresult
    2937           1 : nsDocShell::HistoryTransactionRemoved(int32_t aIndex)
    2938             : {
    2939             :   // These indices are used for fastback cache eviction, to determine
    2940             :   // which session history entries are candidates for content viewer
    2941             :   // eviction.  We need to adjust by the number of entries that we
    2942             :   // just purged from history, so that we look at the right session history
    2943             :   // entries during eviction.
    2944           1 :   if (aIndex == mPreviousTransIndex) {
    2945           1 :     mPreviousTransIndex = -1;
    2946           1 :   } else if (aIndex < mPreviousTransIndex) {
    2947           1 :     --mPreviousTransIndex;
    2948             :   }
    2949           1 :   if (mLoadedTransIndex == aIndex) {
    2950           1 :     mLoadedTransIndex = 0;
    2951           1 :   } else if (aIndex < mLoadedTransIndex) {
    2952           1 :     --mLoadedTransIndex;
    2953             :   }
    2954             : 
    2955           1 :   nsTObserverArray<nsDocLoader*>::ForwardIterator iter(mChildList);
    2956           1 :   while (iter.HasMore()) {
    2957           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> shell = do_QueryObject(iter.GetNext());
    2958           1 :     if (shell) {
    2959           1 :       static_cast<nsDocShell*>(shell.get())->HistoryTransactionRemoved(aIndex);
    2960             :     }
    2961             :   }
    2962             : 
    2963           1 :   return NS_OK;

    3320             : void
    3321           1 : nsDocShell::RecomputeCanExecuteScripts()
    3322             : {
    3323           1 :   bool old = mCanExecuteScripts;
    3324           1 :   RefPtr<nsDocShell> parent = GetParentDocshell();
    3325             : 
    3326             :   // If we have no tree owner, that means that we've been detached from the
    3327             :   // docshell tree (this is distinct from having no parent dochshell, which
    3328             :   // is the case for root docshells). It would be nice to simply disallow
    3329             :   // script in detached docshells, but bug 986542 demonstrates that this
    3330             :   // behavior breaks at least one website.
    3331             :   //
    3332             :   // So instead, we use our previous value, unless mAllowJavascript has been
    3333             :   // explicitly set to false.
    3334           1 :   if (!mTreeOwner) {
    3335           1 :     mCanExecuteScripts = mCanExecuteScripts && mAllowJavascript;
    3336             :     // If scripting has been explicitly disabled on our docshell, we're done.
    3337           1 :   } else if (!mAllowJavascript) {
    3338           1 :     mCanExecuteScripts = false;
    3339             :     // If we have a parent, inherit.
    3340           1 :   } else if (parent) {
    3341           1 :     mCanExecuteScripts = parent->mCanExecuteScripts;
    3342             :     // Otherwise, we're the root of the tree, and we haven't explicitly disabled
    3343             :     // script. Allow.
    3344             :   } else {
    3345           1 :     mCanExecuteScripts = true;
    3346             :   }
    3347             : 
    3348             :   // Inform our active DOM window.
    3349             :   //
    3350             :   // This will pass the outer, which will be in the scope of the active inner.
    3351           1 :   if (mScriptGlobal && mScriptGlobal->GetGlobalJSObject()) {
    3352             :     xpc::Scriptability& scriptability =
    3353           1 :       xpc::Scriptability::Get(mScriptGlobal->GetGlobalJSObject());
    3354           1 :     scriptability.SetDocShellAllowsScript(mCanExecuteScripts);
    3355             :   }
    3356             : 
    3357             :   // If our value has changed, our children might be affected. Recompute their
    3358             :   // value as well.
    3359           1 :   if (old != mCanExecuteScripts) {
    3360           1 :     nsTObserverArray<nsDocLoader*>::ForwardIterator iter(mChildList);
    3361           1 :     while (iter.HasMore()) {
    3362           1 :       static_cast<nsDocShell*>(iter.GetNext())->RecomputeCanExecuteScripts();
    3363             :     }
    3364           1 :   }
    3365           1 : }

    3563             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aTargetItem, "Must have target item!");
    3564             : 
    3565           1 :   if (!gValidateOrigin || !aAccessingItem) {
    3566             :     // Good to go
    3567             :     return true;
    3568             :   }
    3569             : 
    3570             :   // XXXbz should we care if aAccessingItem or the document therein is
    3571             :   // chrome?  Should those get extra privileges?
    3572             : 
    3573             :   // For historical context, see:
    3574             :   //
    3575             :   // Bug 13871:  Prevent frameset spoofing
    3576             :   // Bug 103638: Targets with same name in different windows open in wrong
    3577             :   //             window with javascript
    3578             :   // Bug 408052: Adopt "ancestor" frame navigation policy
    3579             : 
    3580             :   // Now do a security check.
    3581             :   //
    3582             :   // Disallow navigation if the two frames are not part of the same app, or if
    3583             :   // they have different is-in-browser-element states.
    3584             :   //
    3585             :   // Allow navigation if
    3586             :   //  1) aAccessingItem can script aTargetItem or one of its ancestors in
    3587             :   //     the frame hierarchy or
    3588             :   //  2) aTargetItem is a top-level frame and aAccessingItem is its descendant
    3589             :   //  3) aTargetItem is a top-level frame and aAccessingItem can target
    3590             :   //     its opener per rule (1) or (2).
    3591             : 
    3592           1 :   if (aTargetItem == aAccessingItem) {
    3593             :     // A frame is allowed to navigate itself.
    3594             :     return true;
    3595             :   }
    3596             : 
    3597           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> targetDS = do_QueryInterface(aTargetItem);
    3598           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> accessingDS = do_QueryInterface(aAccessingItem);
    3599           1 :   if (!targetDS || !accessingDS) {
    3600             :     // We must be able to convert both to nsIDocShell.
    3601             :     return false;
    3602             :   }
    3603             : 
    3604           1 :   if (targetDS->GetIsInIsolatedMozBrowserElement() !=
    3605           1 :         accessingDS->GetIsInIsolatedMozBrowserElement()) {
    3606             :     return false;
    3607             :   }
    3608             : 
    3609             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem> accessingRoot;
    3610           1 :   aAccessingItem->GetSameTypeRootTreeItem(getter_AddRefs(accessingRoot));
    3611           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> accessingRootDS = do_QueryInterface(accessingRoot);
    3612             : 
    3613             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem> targetRoot;
    3614           1 :   aTargetItem->GetSameTypeRootTreeItem(getter_AddRefs(targetRoot));
    3615           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> targetRootDS = do_QueryInterface(targetRoot);
    3616             : 
    3617             :   OriginAttributes targetOA =
    3618           1 :     static_cast<nsDocShell*>(targetDS.get())->GetOriginAttributes();
    3619             :   OriginAttributes accessingOA =
    3620           1 :     static_cast<nsDocShell*>(accessingDS.get())->GetOriginAttributes();
    3621             : 
    3622             :   // When the first party isolation is on, the top-level docShell may not have
    3623             :   // the firstPartyDomain in its originAttributes, but its document will have
    3624             :   // it. So we get the firstPartyDomain from the nodePrincipal of the document
    3625             :   // before we compare the originAttributes.

    3627           0 :     if (aAccessingItem->ItemType() == nsIDocShellTreeItem::typeContent &&

    3636           0 :           accessingPrincipal->OriginAttributesRef().mFirstPartyDomain;

    3640           0 :     if (aTargetItem->ItemType() == nsIDocShellTreeItem::typeContent &&
    3641           0 :         (targetDS == targetRootDS || targetDS->GetIsMozBrowser())) {
    3642             : 
    3643           0 :       nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> targetDoc = aAccessingItem->GetDocument();
    3644             : 
    3645           0 :       if (targetDoc) {
    3646           0 :         nsCOMPtr<nsIPrincipal> targetPrincipal = targetDoc->NodePrincipal();
    3647             : 
    3648           0 :         targetOA.mFirstPartyDomain =
    3649           0 :           targetPrincipal->OriginAttributesRef().mFirstPartyDomain;
    3650             :       }
    3651             :     }
    3652             :   }
    3653             : 
    3654           1 :   if (targetOA != accessingOA) {
    3655             :     return false;
    3656             :   }
    3657             : 
    3658             :   // A private document can't access a non-private one, and vice versa.
    3659           1 :   if (static_cast<nsDocShell*>(targetDS.get())->UsePrivateBrowsing() !=
    3660           1 :       static_cast<nsDocShell*>(accessingDS.get())->UsePrivateBrowsing()) {
    3661             :     return false;
    3662             :   }
    3663             : 
    3664           1 :   if (aTargetItem == accessingRoot) {
    3665             :     // A frame can navigate its root.
    3666             :     return true;
    3667             :   }
    3668             : 
    3669             :   // Check if aAccessingItem can navigate one of aTargetItem's ancestors.
    3670           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem> target = aTargetItem;

    3672           1 :     if (ValidateOrigin(aAccessingItem, target)) {
    3673           1 :       return true;
    3674             :     }
    3675             : 
    3676             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem> parent;

    3684             :     // allow access.

    3686             :   }
    3687             :

    3689             :     // All done here

    3702             : 
    3703           1 :   if (!openerItem) {
    3704             :     return false;
    3705             :   }
    3706             : 
    3707           1 :   return CanAccessItem(openerItem, aAccessingItem, false);

    3797           1 : nsDocShell::DoFindItemWithName(const nsAString& aName,

    3859           1 : nsDocShell::IsSandboxedFrom(nsIDocShell* aTargetDocShell)
    3860             : {
    3861             :   // If no target then not sandboxed.
    3862           1 :   if (!aTargetDocShell) {
    3863             :     return false;

    3866             :   // We cannot be sandboxed from ourselves.

    4037           1 :   while (iter.HasMore()) {

    4049             :   // SetDocLoaderParent(), but not so for the root DocShell, where the call to
    4050             :   // SetTreeOwner() happens after the initial AddDocLoaderAsChildOfRoot(),
    4051             :   // and we never set another parent. Given that this is neither expensive nor
    4052             :   // performance-critical, let's be safe and unconditionally recompute this
    4053             :   // state whenever dependent state changes.
    4054           1 :   RecomputeCanExecuteScripts();

    6717           1 : nsDocShell::RefreshURI(nsIURI* aURI, int32_t aDelay, bool aRepeat,
    6718             :                        bool aMetaRefresh)
    6719             : {

    6721             : 
    6722             :   /* Check if Meta refresh/redirects are permitted. Some
    6723             :    * embedded applications may not want to do this.
    6724             :    * Must do this before sending out NOTIFY_REFRESH events
    6725             :    * because listeners may have side effects (e.g. displaying a
    6726             :    * button to manually trigger the refresh later).
    6727             :    */
    6728           1 :   bool allowRedirects = true;
    6729           1 :   GetAllowMetaRedirects(&allowRedirects);
    6730           1 :   if (!allowRedirects) {
    6731             :     return NS_OK;
    6732             :   }
    6733             :

    6735             :   // give them a chance to block this refresh.
    6736             :   bool sameURI;

    6738           1 :   if (NS_FAILED(rv)) {
    6739           0 :     sameURI = false;
    6740             :   }

    6742             :     return NS_OK;
    6743             :   }

    6747             :   GetBusyFlags(&busyFlags);

    6749           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsISupports> dataRef = refreshTimer;  // Get the ref count to 1
    6750             : 
    6751           1 :   refreshTimer->mDocShell = this;

    6753           1 :   refreshTimer->mDelay = aDelay;
    6754           1 :   refreshTimer->mRepeat = aRepeat;
    6755           1 :   refreshTimer->mMetaRefresh = aMetaRefresh;
    6756             : 
    6757           1 :   if (!mRefreshURIList) {
    6758           1 :     mRefreshURIList = nsArray::Create();
    6759             :   }
    6760             :

    6763             :     // and trigger the timer in EndPageLoad() or whenever we become active.

    6767             :     // timer and fire it right away.

    6780             : nsresult
    6781           1 : nsDocShell::ForceRefreshURIFromTimer(nsIURI* aURI,

    6805             : NS_IMETHODIMP
    6806           1 : nsDocShell::ForceRefreshURI(nsIURI* aURI, int32_t aDelay, bool aMetaRefresh)
    6807             : {
    6808           1 :   NS_ENSURE_ARG(aURI);
    6809             : 
    6810             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellLoadInfo> loadInfo;
    6811           1 :   CreateLoadInfo(getter_AddRefs(loadInfo));
    6812           1 :   NS_ENSURE_TRUE(loadInfo, NS_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY);
    6813             : 
    6814             :   /* We do need to pass in a referrer, but we don't want it to
    6815             :    * be sent to the server.
    6816             :    */
    6817           1 :   loadInfo->SetSendReferrer(false);
    6818             : 
    6819             :   /* for most refreshes the current URI is an appropriate
    6820             :    * internal referrer
    6821             :    */
    6822           1 :   loadInfo->SetReferrer(mCurrentURI);
    6823             : 
    6824             :   /* Don't ever "guess" on which principal to use to avoid picking
    6825             :    * the current principal.
    6826             :    */
    6827           1 :   loadInfo->SetPrincipalIsExplicit(true);
    6828             : 
    6829             :   /* Check if this META refresh causes a redirection
    6830             :    * to another site.
    6831             :    */
    6832           1 :   bool equalUri = false;
    6833           1 :   nsresult rv = aURI->Equals(mCurrentURI, &equalUri);
    6834           1 :   if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv) && (!equalUri) && aMetaRefresh &&
    6835           1 :       aDelay <= REFRESH_REDIRECT_TIMER) {
    6836             :     /* It is a META refresh based redirection within the threshold time
    6837             :      * we have in mind (15000 ms as defined by REFRESH_REDIRECT_TIMER).
    6838             :      * Pass a REPLACE flag to LoadURI().
    6839             :      */
    6840           1 :     loadInfo->SetLoadType(nsIDocShellLoadInfo::loadNormalReplace);
    6841             : 
    6842             :     /* for redirects we mimic HTTP, which passes the
    6843             :      *  original referrer

    6846           1 :     GetReferringURI(getter_AddRefs(internalReferrer));

    6849             :     }

    6851           1 :     loadInfo->SetLoadType(nsIDocShellLoadInfo::loadRefresh);
    6852             :   }

    6855             :    * LoadURI(...) will cancel all refresh timers... This causes the
    6856             :    * Timer and its refreshData instance to be released...

    6859             : 
    6860           1 :   return NS_OK;

    6862             : 
    6863             : nsresult
    6864           1 : nsDocShell::SetupRefreshURIFromHeader(nsIURI* aBaseURI,
    6865             :                                       nsIPrincipal* aPrincipal,
    6866             :                                       const nsACString& aHeader)
    6867             : {
    6868             :   // Refresh headers are parsed with the following format in mind
    6869             :   // <META HTTP-EQUIV=REFRESH CONTENT="5; URL=http://uri">
    6870             :   // By the time we are here, the following is true:
    6871             :   // header = "REFRESH"
    6872             :   // content = "5; URL=http://uri" // note the URL attribute is
    6873             :   // optional, if it is absent, the currently loaded url is used.
    6874             :   // Also note that the seconds and URL separator can be either
    6875             :   // a ';' or a ','. The ',' separator should be illegal but CNN
    6876             :   // is using it.
    6877             :   //
    6878             :   // We need to handle the following strings, where
    6879             :   //  - X is a set of digits
    6880             :   //  - URI is either a relative or absolute URI
    6881             :   //
    6882             :   // Note that URI should start with "url=" but we allow omission
    6883             :   //
    6884             :   // "" || ";" || ","
    6885             :   //  empty string. use the currently loaded URI
    6886             :   //  and refresh immediately.
    6887             :   // "X" || "X;" || "X,"
    6888             :   //  Refresh the currently loaded URI in X seconds.
    6889             :   // "X; URI" || "X, URI"
    6890             :   //  Refresh using URI as the destination in X seconds.
    6891             :   // "URI" || "; URI" || ", URI"
    6892             :   //  Refresh immediately using URI as the destination.
    6893             :   //
    6894             :   // Currently, anything immediately following the URI, if
    6895             :   // separated by any char in the set "'\"\t\r\n " will be
    6896             :   // ignored. So "10; url=go.html ; foo=bar" will work,
    6897             :   // and so will "10; url='go.html'; foo=bar". However,
    6898             :   // "10; url=go.html; foo=bar" will result in the uri
    6899             :   // "go.html;" since ';' and ',' are valid uri characters.
    6900             :   //
    6901             :   // Note that we need to remove any tokens wrapping the URI.
    6902             :   // These tokens currently include spaces, double and single
    6903             :   // quotes.
    6904             : 
    6905             :   // when done, seconds is 0 or the given number of seconds
    6906             :   //            uriAttrib is empty or the URI specified
    6907             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aPrincipal);
    6908             : 
    6909           1 :   nsAutoCString uriAttrib;
    6910           1 :   int32_t seconds = 0;
    6911           1 :   bool specifiesSeconds = false;
    6912             : 
    6913             :   nsACString::const_iterator iter, tokenStart, doneIterating;
    6914             : 
    6915           1 :   aHeader.BeginReading(iter);
    6916           1 :   aHeader.EndReading(doneIterating);
    6917             : 
    6918             :   // skip leading whitespace
    6919           1 :   while (iter != doneIterating && nsCRT::IsAsciiSpace(*iter)) {
    6920             :     ++iter;
    6921             :   }
    6922             : 
    6923           1 :   tokenStart = iter;
    6924             : 
    6925             :   // skip leading + and -
    6926           1 :   if (iter != doneIterating && (*iter == '-' || *iter == '+')) {
    6927             :     ++iter;
    6928             :   }
    6929             : 
    6930             :   // parse number
    6931           1 :   while (iter != doneIterating && (*iter >= '0' && *iter <= '9')) {
    6932           1 :     seconds = seconds * 10 + (*iter - '0');
    6933           1 :     specifiesSeconds = true;
    6934             :     ++iter;
    6935             :   }
    6936             : 
    6937           1 :   if (iter != doneIterating) {
    6938             :     // if we started with a '-', number is negative
    6939           1 :     if (*tokenStart == '-') {
    6940           0 :       seconds = -seconds;
    6941             :     }
    6942             : 
    6943             :     // skip to next ';' or ','
    6944           1 :     nsACString::const_iterator iterAfterDigit = iter;
    6945           1 :     while (iter != doneIterating && !(*iter == ';' || *iter == ',')) {
    6946           1 :       if (specifiesSeconds) {
    6947             :         // Non-whitespace characters here mean that the string is
    6948             :         // malformed but tolerate sites that specify a decimal point,
    6949             :         // even though meta refresh only works on whole seconds.
    6950           1 :         if (iter == iterAfterDigit &&
    6951           1 :             !nsCRT::IsAsciiSpace(*iter) && *iter != '.') {
    6952             :           // The characters between the seconds and the next
    6953             :           // section are just garbage!
    6954             :           //   e.g. content="2a0z+,URL=http://www.mozilla.org/"
    6955             :           // Just ignore this redirect.
    6956             :           return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
    6957           1 :         } else if (nsCRT::IsAsciiSpace(*iter)) {
    6958             :           // We've had at least one whitespace so tolerate the mistake
    6959             :           // and drop through.
    6960             :           // e.g. content="10 foo"
    6961             :           ++iter;
    6962             :           break;
    6963             :         }
    6964             :       }
    6965             :       ++iter;
    6966             :     }
    6967             : 
    6968             :     // skip any remaining whitespace
    6969           1 :     while (iter != doneIterating && nsCRT::IsAsciiSpace(*iter)) {
    6970             :       ++iter;
    6971             :     }
    6972             : 
    6973             :     // skip ';' or ','
    6974           1 :     if (iter != doneIterating && (*iter == ';' || *iter == ',')) {
    6975             :       ++iter;
    6976             :     }
    6977             : 
    6978             :     // skip whitespace
    6979           1 :     while (iter != doneIterating && nsCRT::IsAsciiSpace(*iter)) {
    6980             :       ++iter;
    6981             :     }
    6982             :   }
    6983             : 
    6984             :   // possible start of URI
    6985           1 :   tokenStart = iter;
    6986             : 
    6987             :   // skip "url = " to real start of URI
    6988           1 :   if (iter != doneIterating && (*iter == 'u' || *iter == 'U')) {
    6989             :     ++iter;
    6990           1 :     if (iter != doneIterating && (*iter == 'r' || *iter == 'R')) {
    6991             :       ++iter;
    6992           1 :       if (iter != doneIterating && (*iter == 'l' || *iter == 'L')) {
    6993             :         ++iter;
    6994             : 
    6995             :         // skip whitespace
    6996           1 :         while (iter != doneIterating && nsCRT::IsAsciiSpace(*iter)) {
    6997             :           ++iter;
    6998             :         }
    6999             : 
    7000           1 :         if (iter != doneIterating && *iter == '=') {
    7001             :           ++iter;
    7002             : 
    7003             :           // skip whitespace
    7004           1 :           while (iter != doneIterating && nsCRT::IsAsciiSpace(*iter)) {
    7005             :             ++iter;
    7006             :           }
    7007             : 
    7008             :           // found real start of URI
    7009           1 :           tokenStart = iter;
    7010             :         }
    7011             :       }
    7012             :     }
    7013             :   }
    7014             : 
    7015             :   // skip a leading '"' or '\''.
    7016             : 
    7017           1 :   bool isQuotedURI = false;
    7018           1 :   if (tokenStart != doneIterating &&
    7019           1 :       (*tokenStart == '"' || *tokenStart == '\'')) {
    7020           0 :     isQuotedURI = true;
    7021             :     ++tokenStart;
    7022             :   }
    7023             : 
    7024             :   // set iter to start of URI
    7025           1 :   iter = tokenStart;
    7026             : 
    7027             :   // tokenStart here points to the beginning of URI
    7028             : 
    7029             :   // grab the rest of the URI
    7030           1 :   while (iter != doneIterating) {
    7031           1 :     if (isQuotedURI && (*iter == '"' || *iter == '\'')) {
    7032             :       break;
    7033             :     }
    7034             :     ++iter;
    7035             :   }
    7036             : 
    7037             :   // move iter one back if the last character is a '"' or '\''
    7038           1 :   if (iter != tokenStart && isQuotedURI) {
    7039             :     --iter;
    7040           0 :     if (!(*iter == '"' || *iter == '\'')) {
    7041             :       ++iter;
    7042             :     }
    7043             :   }
    7044             : 
    7045             :   // URI is whatever's contained from tokenStart to iter.
    7046             :   // note: if tokenStart == doneIterating, so is iter.
    7047             : 
    7048           1 :   nsresult rv = NS_OK;
    7049             : 
    7050             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> uri;
    7051           1 :   bool specifiesURI = false;
    7052           1 :   if (tokenStart == iter) {
    7053             :     uri = aBaseURI;
    7054             :   } else {
    7055           1 :     uriAttrib = Substring(tokenStart, iter);
    7056             :     // NS_NewURI takes care of any whitespace surrounding the URL
    7057           1 :     rv = NS_NewURI(getter_AddRefs(uri), uriAttrib, nullptr, aBaseURI);
    7058           1 :     specifiesURI = true;
    7059             :   }
    7060             : 
    7061             :   // No URI or seconds were specified
    7062           1 :   if (!specifiesSeconds && !specifiesURI) {
    7063             :     // Do nothing because the alternative is to spin around in a refresh
    7064             :     // loop forever!
    7065             :     return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
    7066             :   }
    7067             : 
    7068           1 :   if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv)) {
    7069             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIScriptSecurityManager> securityManager(
    7070           1 :       do_GetService(NS_SCRIPTSECURITYMANAGER_CONTRACTID, &rv));
    7071           1 :     if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv)) {
    7072             :       rv = securityManager->CheckLoadURIWithPrincipal(
    7073             :         aPrincipal, uri,
    7074           1 :         nsIScriptSecurityManager::LOAD_IS_AUTOMATIC_DOCUMENT_REPLACEMENT);
    7075             : 
    7076           1 :       if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv)) {
    7077           1 :         bool isjs = true;
    7078             :         rv = NS_URIChainHasFlags(
    7079           1 :           uri, nsIProtocolHandler::URI_OPENING_EXECUTES_SCRIPT, &isjs);
    7080           1 :         NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, rv);
    7081             : 
    7082           1 :         if (isjs) {
    7083             :           return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
    7084             :         }
    7085             :       }
    7086             : 
    7087           1 :       if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv)) {
    7088             :         // Since we can't travel back in time yet, just pretend
    7089             :         // negative numbers do nothing at all.
    7090           1 :         if (seconds < 0) {
    7091             :           return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
    7092             :         }
    7093             : 
    7094           1 :         rv = RefreshURI(uri, seconds * 1000, false, true);
    7095             :       }
    7096             :     }
    7097             :   }
    7098           1 :   return rv;
    7099             : }

    7480             : void
    7481           1 : nsDocShell::OnRedirectStateChange(nsIChannel* aOldChannel,
    7482             :                                   nsIChannel* aNewChannel,
    7483             :                                   uint32_t aRedirectFlags,
    7484             :                                   uint32_t aStateFlags)
    7485             : {
    7486             :   NS_ASSERTION(aStateFlags & STATE_REDIRECTING,
    7487             :                "Calling OnRedirectStateChange when there is no redirect");
    7488             : 
    7489             :   // If mixed content is allowed for the old channel, we forward
    7490             :   // the permission to the new channel if it has the same origin
    7491             :   // as the old one.
    7492           1 :   if (mMixedContentChannel && mMixedContentChannel == aOldChannel) {
    7493           0 :     nsresult rv = nsContentUtils::CheckSameOrigin(mMixedContentChannel, aNewChannel);
    7494           0 :     if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv)) {
    7495             :       SetMixedContentChannel(aNewChannel); // Same origin: forward permission.
    7496             :     } else {
    7497             :       SetMixedContentChannel(nullptr); // Different origin: clear mMixedContentChannel.
    7498             :     }
    7499             :   }
    7500             : 
    7501           1 :   if (!(aStateFlags & STATE_IS_DOCUMENT)) {
    7502           1 :     return;  // not a toplevel document
    7503             :   }
    7504             : 
    7505             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> oldURI, newURI;
    7506           1 :   aOldChannel->GetURI(getter_AddRefs(oldURI));
    7507           1 :   aNewChannel->GetURI(getter_AddRefs(newURI));
    7508           1 :   if (!oldURI || !newURI) {
    7509             :     return;
    7510             :   }
    7511             : 
    7512             :   // Below a URI visit is saved (see AddURIVisit method doc).
    7513             :   // The visit chain looks something like:
    7514             :   //   ...
    7515             :   //   Site N - 1
    7516             :   //                =>  Site N
    7517             :   //   (redirect to =>) Site N + 1 (we are here!)
    7518             : 
    7519             :   // Get N - 1 and transition type
    7520             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> previousURI;
    7521           1 :   uint32_t previousFlags = 0;
    7522           1 :   ExtractLastVisit(aOldChannel, getter_AddRefs(previousURI), &previousFlags);
    7523             : 
    7524           1 :   if (aRedirectFlags & nsIChannelEventSink::REDIRECT_INTERNAL ||
    7525           1 :       ChannelIsPost(aOldChannel)) {
    7526             :     // 1. Internal redirects are ignored because they are specific to the
    7527             :     //    channel implementation.
    7528             :     // 2. POSTs are not saved by global history.
    7529             :     //
    7530             :     // Regardless, we need to propagate the previous visit to the new
    7531             :     // channel.
    7532           1 :     SaveLastVisit(aNewChannel, previousURI, previousFlags);
    7533             :   } else {
    7534             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> referrer;
    7535             :     // Treat referrer as null if there is an error getting it.
    7536           1 :     (void)NS_GetReferrerFromChannel(aOldChannel, getter_AddRefs(referrer));
    7537             : 
    7538             :     // Get the HTTP response code, if available.
    7539           1 :     uint32_t responseStatus = 0;
    7540           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIHttpChannel> httpChannel = do_QueryInterface(aOldChannel);
    7541           1 :     if (httpChannel) {
    7542           1 :       Unused << httpChannel->GetResponseStatus(&responseStatus);
    7543             :     }
    7544             : 
    7545             :     // Add visit N -1 => N
    7546           1 :     AddURIVisit(oldURI, referrer, previousURI, previousFlags, responseStatus);
    7547             : 
    7548             :     // Since N + 1 could be the final destination, we will not save N => N + 1
    7549             :     // here.  OnNewURI will do that, so we will cache it.
    7550           1 :     SaveLastVisit(aNewChannel, oldURI, aRedirectFlags);
    7551             :   }
    7552             : 
    7553             :   // check if the new load should go through the application cache.
    7554             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIApplicationCacheChannel> appCacheChannel =
    7555           1 :     do_QueryInterface(aNewChannel);
    7556           1 :   if (appCacheChannel) {
    7557           1 :     if (GeckoProcessType_Default != XRE_GetProcessType()) {
    7558             :       // Permission will be checked in the parent process.
    7559           0 :       appCacheChannel->SetChooseApplicationCache(true);
    7560             :     } else {
    7561             :       nsCOMPtr<nsIScriptSecurityManager> secMan =
    7562           1 :         do_GetService(NS_SCRIPTSECURITYMANAGER_CONTRACTID);
    7563             : 
    7564           1 :       if (secMan) {
    7565             :         nsCOMPtr<nsIPrincipal> principal;
    7566             :         secMan->GetDocShellCodebasePrincipal(newURI, this,
    7567           1 :                                              getter_AddRefs(principal));
    7568             :         appCacheChannel->SetChooseApplicationCache(
    7569           1 :           NS_ShouldCheckAppCache(principal, UsePrivateBrowsing()));
    7570             :       }
    7571             :     }
    7572             :   }
    7573             : 
    7574           1 :   if (!(aRedirectFlags & nsIChannelEventSink::REDIRECT_INTERNAL) &&
    7575           1 :       mLoadType & (LOAD_CMD_RELOAD | LOAD_CMD_HISTORY)) {
    7576           1 :     mLoadType = LOAD_NORMAL_REPLACE;
    7577           1 :     SetHistoryEntry(&mLSHE, nullptr);
    7578             :   }
    7579             : }

    8558             : class MOZ_STACK_CLASS PresentationEventForgetter

    8577           1 :       mRestorePresentationEvent.Forget();

    8590             : nsresult
    8591           1 : nsDocShell::RestoreFromHistory()
    8592             : {
    8593             :   MOZ_ASSERT(mRestorePresentationEvent.IsPending());
    8594           1 :   PresentationEventForgetter forgetter(mRestorePresentationEvent);
    8595             : 
    8596             :   // This section of code follows the same ordering as CreateContentViewer.
    8597           1 :   if (!mLSHE) {
    8598             :     return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
    8599             :   }
    8600             : 
    8601             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIContentViewer> viewer;

    8603           1 :   if (!viewer) {
    8604             :     return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
    8605             :   }
    8606             : 
    8607           1 :   if (mSavingOldViewer) {

    9046             :   // Make sure this presentation is the same size as the previous
    9047             :   // presentation.  If this is not the same size we showed it at last time,
    9048             :   // then we need to resize the widget.
    9049             : 
    9050             :   // XXXbryner   This interacts poorly with Firefox's infobar.  If the old
    9051             :   // presentation had the infobar visible, then we will resize the new
    9052             :   // presentation to that smaller size.  However, firing the locationchanged
    9053             :   // event will hide the infobar, which will immediately resize the window
    9054             :   // back to the larger size.  A future optimization might be to restore
    9055             :   // the presentation at the "wrong" size, then fire the locationchanged
    9056             :   // event and check whether the docshell's new size is the same as the
    9057             :   // cached viewer size (skipping the resize if they are equal).
    9058             :

    9071             :       }
    9072             :     }

    9526             : nsresult
    9527           1 : nsDocShell::CheckLoadingPermissions()
    9528             : {
    9529             :   // This method checks whether the caller may load content into
    9530             :   // this docshell. Even though we've done our best to hide windows
    9531             :   // from code that doesn't have the right to access them, it's
    9532             :   // still possible for an evil site to open a window and access
    9533             :   // frames in the new window through window.frames[] (which is
    9534             :   // allAccess for historic reasons), so we still need to do this
    9535             :   // check on load.
    9536           1 :   nsresult rv = NS_OK;
    9537             : 
    9538           1 :   if (!gValidateOrigin || !IsFrame()) {
    9539             :     // Origin validation was turned off, or we're not a frame.
    9540             :     // Permit all loads.
    9541             : 
    9542             :     return rv;
    9543             :   }
    9544             : 
    9545             :   // Note - The check for a current JSContext here isn't necessarily sensical.
    9546             :   // It's just designed to preserve the old semantics during a mass-conversion
    9547             :   // patch.
    9548           1 :   if (!nsContentUtils::GetCurrentJSContext()) {
    9549             :     return NS_OK;
    9550             :   }
    9551             : 
    9552             :   // Check if the caller is from the same origin as this docshell,
    9553             :   // or any of its ancestors.
    9554           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem> item(this);
    9555           1 :   do {
    9556           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIScriptGlobalObject> sgo = do_GetInterface(item);
    9557           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIScriptObjectPrincipal> sop(do_QueryInterface(sgo));
    9558             : 
    9559             :     nsIPrincipal* p;
    9560           1 :     if (!sop || !(p = sop->GetPrincipal())) {
    9561             :       return NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED;
    9562             :     }
    9563             :

    9746             : /**
    9747             :  * Returns true if we started an asynchronous load (i.e., from the network), but
    9748             :  * the document we're loading there hasn't yet become this docshell's active
    9749             :  * document.
    9750             :  *
    9751             :  * When JustStartedNetworkLoad is true, you should be careful about modifying
    9752             :  * mLoadType and mLSHE.  These are both set when the asynchronous load first
    9753             :  * starts, and the load expects that, when it eventually runs InternalLoad,
    9754             :  * mLoadType and mLSHE will have their original values.

    9992           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIPrincipal> principalToInherit = aPrincipalToInherit;
    9993             :   //
    9994             :   // Get a principal from the current document if necessary.  Note that we only
    9995             :   // do this for URIs that inherit a security context and local file URIs;
    9996             :   // in particular we do NOT do this for about:blank.  This way, random
    9997             :   // about:blank loads that have no principal (which basically means they were
    9998             :   // done by someone from chrome manually messing with our nsIWebNavigation
    9999             :   // or by C++ setting document.location) don't get a funky principal.  If
   10000             :   // callers want something interesting to happen with the about:blank

   10366             :     // A short-circuited load happens when we navigate between two SHEntries
   10367             :     // for the same document.  We do a short-circuited load under two
   10368             :     // circumstances.  Either
   10369             :     //
   10370             :     //  a) we're navigating between two different SHEntries which share a
   10371             :     //     document, or
   10372             :     //
   10373             :     //  b) we're navigating to a new shentry whose URI differs from the
   10374             :     //     current URI only in its hash, the new hash is non-empty, and
   10375             :     //     we're not doing a POST.
   10376             :     //
   10377             :     // The restriction tha the SHEntries in (a) must be different ensures
   10378             :     // that history.go(0) and the like trigger full refreshes, rather than
   10379             :     // short-circuited loads.

   10381           1 :       (historyNavBetweenSameDoc && mOSHE != aSHEntry) ||

   11382           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIHttpChannel> httpChannel = do_QueryInterface(aGenericChannel);

   11384             : 
   11385             :   uint32_t numRead;
   11386           0 :   nsAutoCString headersString;

   11388             :                                            &headersString,
   11389             :                                            UINT32_MAX,
   11390           0 :                                            &numRead);
   11391           0 :   NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, rv);
   11392             : 
   11393             :   // used during the manipulation of the String from the InputStream
   11394           0 :   nsAutoCString headerName;
   11395           0 :   nsAutoCString headerValue;
   11396             :   int32_t crlf;
   11397             :   int32_t colon;
   11398             : 
   11399             :   //
   11400             :   // Iterate over the headersString: for each "\r\n" delimited chunk,
   11401             :   // add the value as a header to the nsIHttpChannel
   11402             :   //
   11403             : 
   11404             :   static const char kWhitespace[] = "\b\t\r\n ";
   11405             :   while (true) {
   11406           0 :     crlf = headersString.Find("\r\n");
   11407           0 :     if (crlf == kNotFound) {
   11408             :       return NS_OK;
   11409             :     }
   11410             : 
   11411           0 :     const nsCSubstring& oneHeader = StringHead(headersString, crlf);
   11412             : 
   11413           0 :     colon = oneHeader.FindChar(':');
   11414           0 :     if (colon == kNotFound) {
   11415             :       return NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED;
   11416             :     }
   11417             : 
   11418           0 :     headerName = StringHead(oneHeader, colon);
   11419           0 :     headerValue = Substring(oneHeader, colon + 1);
   11420             : 
   11421           0 :     headerName.Trim(kWhitespace);
   11422           0 :     headerValue.Trim(kWhitespace);
   11423             : 
   11424           0 :     headersString.Cut(0, crlf + 2);
   11425             : 
   11426             :     //
   11427             :     // FINALLY: we can set the header!
   11428             :     //
   11429             : 
   11430           0 :     rv = httpChannel->SetRequestHeader(headerName, headerValue, true);
   11431           0 :     NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, rv);
   11432             :   }
   11433             : 
   11434             :   NS_NOTREACHED("oops");
   11435             :   return NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED;
   11436             : }
   11437             : 
   11438             : nsresult
   11439           1 : nsDocShell::DoChannelLoad(nsIChannel* aChannel,
   11440             :                           nsIURILoader* aURILoader,
   11441             :                           bool aBypassClassifier)
   11442             : {
   11443             :   nsresult rv;
   11444             :   // Mark the channel as being a document URI and allow content sniffing...
   11445           1 :   nsLoadFlags loadFlags = 0;
   11446           1 :   (void)aChannel->GetLoadFlags(&loadFlags);
   11447             :   loadFlags |= nsIChannel::LOAD_DOCUMENT_URI |
   11448           1 :                nsIChannel::LOAD_CALL_CONTENT_SNIFFERS;
   11449             : 
   11450             :   // Load attributes depend on load type...
   11451           1 :   switch (mLoadType) {

   11536             : nsresult
   11537           1 : nsDocShell::ScrollToAnchor(bool aCurHasRef, bool aNewHasRef,
   11538             :                            nsACString& aNewHash, uint32_t aLoadType)
   11539             : {
   11540           1 :   if (!mCurrentURI) {
   11541             :     return NS_OK;
   11542             :   }
   11543             : 
   11544           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIPresShell> shell = GetPresShell();

   11547             :     // nothing left to do here.

   11550             : 
   11551           1 :   nsIScrollableFrame* rootScroll = shell->GetRootScrollFrameAsScrollable();

   11553           1 :     rootScroll->ClearDidHistoryRestore();
   11554             :   }
   11555             : 
   11556             :   // If we have no new anchor, we do not want to scroll, unless there is a

   11561             :     return NS_OK;

   11564             :   // Both the new and current URIs refer to the same page. We can now
   11565             :   // browse to the hash stored in the new URI.

   11568             :     // anchor is there, but if it's a load from history,

   11571           1 :                   aLoadType != LOAD_RELOAD_NORMAL;

   11573           1 :     char* str = ToNewCString(aNewHash);
   11574           1 :     if (!str) {
   11575           0 :       return NS_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY;
   11576             :     }
   11577             : 
   11578             :     // nsUnescape modifies the string that is passed into it.
   11579           1 :     nsUnescape(str);
   11580             : 
   11581             :     // We assume that the bytes are in UTF-8, as it says in the
   11582             :     // spec:
   11583             :     // http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/appendix/notes.html#h-B.2.1
   11584             : 
   11585             :     // We try the UTF-8 string first, and then try the document's
   11586             :     // charset (see below).  If the string is not UTF-8,
   11587             :     // conversion will fail and give us an empty Unicode string.
   11588             :     // In that case, we should just fall through to using the
   11589             :     // page's charset.
   11590           1 :     nsresult rv = NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
   11591           1 :     NS_ConvertUTF8toUTF16 uStr(str);
   11592           1 :     if (!uStr.IsEmpty()) {
   11593             :       rv = shell->GoToAnchor(NS_ConvertUTF8toUTF16(str), scroll,
   11594           1 :                              nsIPresShell::SCROLL_SMOOTH_AUTO);
   11595             :     }
   11596           1 :     free(str);
   11597             : 
   11598             :     // Above will fail if the anchor name is not UTF-8.  Need to
   11599             :     // convert from document charset to unicode.
   11600           1 :     if (NS_FAILED(rv)) {
   11601             :       // Get a document charset
   11602           1 :       NS_ENSURE_TRUE(mContentViewer, NS_ERROR_FAILURE);
   11603           1 :       nsIDocument* doc = mContentViewer->GetDocument();

   11617           1 :       NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, rv);

   11619             :       // Ignore return value of GoToAnchor, since it will return an error

   11917             : bool
