   11945             : 
   11946             : //*****************************************************************************
   11947             : // nsDocShell: Session History
   11948             : //*****************************************************************************
   11949             : 
   11950             : NS_IMETHODIMP
   11951           1 : nsDocShell::AddState(JS::Handle<JS::Value> aData, const nsAString& aTitle,
   11952             :                      const nsAString& aURL, bool aReplace, JSContext* aCx)
   11953             : {
   11954             :   // Implements History.pushState and History.replaceState
   11955             : 
   11956             :   // Here's what we do, roughly in the order specified by HTML5:
   11957             :   // 1. Serialize aData using structured clone.
   11958             :   // 2. If the third argument is present,
   11959             :   //     a. Resolve the url, relative to the first script's base URL
   11960             :   //     b. If (a) fails, raise a SECURITY_ERR
   11961             :   //     c. Compare the resulting absolute URL to the document's address.  If
   11962             :   //        any part of the URLs difer other than the <path>, <query>, and
   11963             :   //        <fragment> components, raise a SECURITY_ERR and abort.
   11964             :   // 3. If !aReplace:
   11965             :   //     Remove from the session history all entries after the current entry,
   11966             :   //     as we would after a regular navigation, and save the current
   11967             :   //     entry's scroll position (bug 590573).
   11968             :   // 4. As apropriate, either add a state object entry to the session history
   11969             :   //    after the current entry with the following properties, or modify the
   11970             :   //    current session history entry to set
   11971             :   //      a. cloned data as the state object,
   11972             :   //      b. if the third argument was present, the absolute URL found in
   11973             :   //         step 2
   11974             :   //    Also clear the new history entry's POST data (see bug 580069).
   11975             :   // 5. If aReplace is false (i.e. we're doing a pushState instead of a
   11976             :   //    replaceState), notify bfcache that we've navigated to a new page.
   11977             :   // 6. If the third argument is present, set the document's current address
   11978             :   //    to the absolute URL found in step 2.
   11979             :   //
   11980             :   // It's important that this function not run arbitrary scripts after step 1
   11981             :   // and before completing step 5.  For example, if a script called
   11982             :   // history.back() before we completed step 5, bfcache might destroy an
   11983             :   // active content viewer.  Since EvictOutOfRangeContentViewers at the end of
   11984             :   // step 5 might run script, we can't just put a script blocker around the
   11985             :   // critical section.
   11986             :   //
   11987             :   // Note that we completely ignore the aTitle parameter.
   11988             : 
   11989             :   nsresult rv;
   11990             : 
   11991             :   // Don't clobber the load type of an existing network load.
   11992           1 :   AutoRestore<uint32_t> loadTypeResetter(mLoadType);
   11993             : 
   11994             :   // pushState effectively becomes replaceState when we've started a network
   11995             :   // load but haven't adopted its document yet.  This mirrors what we do with
   11996             :   // changes to the hash at this stage of the game.
   11997           1 :   if (JustStartedNetworkLoad()) {
   11998           1 :     aReplace = true;
   11999             :   }
   12000             : 
   12001           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> document = GetDocument();
   12002           1 :   NS_ENSURE_TRUE(document, NS_ERROR_FAILURE);
   12003             : 
   12004             :   // Step 1: Serialize aData using structured clone.
   12005             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIStructuredCloneContainer> scContainer;
   12006             : 
   12007             :   // scContainer->Init might cause arbitrary JS to run, and this code might
   12008             :   // navigate the page we're on, potentially to a different origin! (bug
   12009             :   // 634834)  To protect against this, we abort if our principal changes due
   12010             :   // to the InitFromJSVal() call.
   12011             :   {
   12012           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> origDocument = GetDocument();
   12013           1 :     if (!origDocument) {
   12014             :       return NS_ERROR_DOM_SECURITY_ERR;
   12015             :     }
   12016           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIPrincipal> origPrincipal = origDocument->NodePrincipal();
   12017             : 
   12018           1 :     scContainer = new nsStructuredCloneContainer();
   12019           1 :     rv = scContainer->InitFromJSVal(aData, aCx);
   12020           1 :     NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, rv);
   12021             : 
   12022           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> newDocument = GetDocument();
   12023           1 :     if (!newDocument) {
   12024             :       return NS_ERROR_DOM_SECURITY_ERR;
   12025             :     }
   12026           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIPrincipal> newPrincipal = newDocument->NodePrincipal();
   12027             : 
   12028           1 :     bool principalsEqual = false;
   12029           1 :     origPrincipal->Equals(newPrincipal, &principalsEqual);
   12030           1 :     NS_ENSURE_TRUE(principalsEqual, NS_ERROR_DOM_SECURITY_ERR);
   12031             :   }
   12032             : 
   12033             :   // Check that the state object isn't too long.
   12034             :   // Default max length: 640k bytes.
   12035             :   int32_t maxStateObjSize =
   12036           1 :     Preferences::GetInt("browser.history.maxStateObjectSize", 0xA0000);
   12037           1 :   if (maxStateObjSize < 0) {
   12038           0 :     maxStateObjSize = 0;
   12039             :   }
   12040             : 
   12041             :   uint64_t scSize;
   12042           1 :   rv = scContainer->GetSerializedNBytes(&scSize);
   12043           1 :   NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, rv);
   12044             : 
   12045           1 :   NS_ENSURE_TRUE(scSize <= (uint32_t)maxStateObjSize, NS_ERROR_ILLEGAL_VALUE);
   12046             : 
   12047             :   // Step 2: Resolve aURL
   12048           1 :   bool equalURIs = true;
   12049             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> currentURI;
   12050           1 :   if (sURIFixup && mCurrentURI) {
   12051           1 :     rv = sURIFixup->CreateExposableURI(mCurrentURI, getter_AddRefs(currentURI));
   12052           1 :     NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, rv);
   12053             :   } else {
   12054           0 :     currentURI = mCurrentURI;
   12055             :   }
   12056           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> oldURI = currentURI;
   12057             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> newURI;
   12058           1 :   if (aURL.Length() == 0) {
   12059           1 :     newURI = currentURI;
   12060             :   } else {
   12061             :     // 2a: Resolve aURL relative to mURI
   12062             : 
   12063           1 :     nsIURI* docBaseURI = document->GetDocBaseURI();
   12064           1 :     if (!docBaseURI) {
   12065           1 :       return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
   12066             :     }
   12067             : 
   12068           1 :     nsAutoCString spec;
   12069           1 :     docBaseURI->GetSpec(spec);
   12070             : 
   12071           1 :     nsAutoCString charset;
   12072           1 :     rv = docBaseURI->GetOriginCharset(charset);
   12073           1 :     NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, NS_ERROR_FAILURE);
   12074             : 
   12075           1 :     rv = NS_NewURI(getter_AddRefs(newURI), aURL, charset.get(), docBaseURI);

   12077             :     // 2b: If 2a fails, raise a SECURITY_ERR
   12078           1 :     if (NS_FAILED(rv)) {
   12079             :       return NS_ERROR_DOM_SECURITY_ERR;
   12080             :     }
   12081             : 
   12082             :     // 2c: Same-origin check.
   12083           1 :     if (!nsContentUtils::URIIsLocalFile(newURI)) {
   12084             :       // In addition to checking that the security manager says that
   12085             :       // the new URI has the same origin as our current URI, we also
   12086             :       // check that the two URIs have the same userpass. (The
   12087             :       // security manager says that |http://foo.com| and
   12088             :       // |http://me@foo.com| have the same origin.)  currentURI
   12089             :       // won't contain the password part of the userpass, so this
   12090             :       // means that it's never valid to specify a password in a
   12091             :       // pushState or replaceState URI.
   12092             : 
   12093             :       nsCOMPtr<nsIScriptSecurityManager> secMan =
   12094           1 :         do_GetService(NS_SCRIPTSECURITYMANAGER_CONTRACTID);
   12095           1 :       NS_ENSURE_TRUE(secMan, NS_ERROR_FAILURE);
   12096             : 
   12097             :       // It's very important that we check that newURI is of the same
   12098             :       // origin as currentURI, not docBaseURI, because a page can
   12099             :       // set docBaseURI arbitrarily to any domain.
   12100           1 :       nsAutoCString currentUserPass, newUserPass;
   12101           1 :       NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(currentURI->GetUserPass(currentUserPass),
   12102             :                         NS_ERROR_FAILURE);
   12103           1 :       NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(newURI->GetUserPass(newUserPass), NS_ERROR_FAILURE);
   12104           1 :       if (NS_FAILED(secMan->CheckSameOriginURI(currentURI, newURI, true)) ||
   12105           1 :           !currentUserPass.Equals(newUserPass)) {
   12106             :         return NS_ERROR_DOM_SECURITY_ERR;
   12107             :       }
   12108             :     } else {
   12109             :       // It's a file:// URI
   12110             :       nsCOMPtr<nsIScriptObjectPrincipal> docScriptObj =
   12111           0 :         do_QueryInterface(document);
   12112             : 
   12113           0 :       if (!docScriptObj) {
   12114             :         return NS_ERROR_DOM_SECURITY_ERR;
   12115             :       }
   12116             : 
   12117           0 :       nsCOMPtr<nsIPrincipal> principal = docScriptObj->GetPrincipal();

   12119           0 :       if (!principal ||

   12121           0 :         return NS_ERROR_DOM_SECURITY_ERR;

   12124             : 
   12125           1 :     if (currentURI) {
   12126           1 :       currentURI->Equals(newURI, &equalURIs);
   12127             :     } else {
   12128           0 :       equalURIs = false;
   12129             :     }

   12131             :   } // end of same-origin check
   12132             : 
   12133             :   // Step 3: Create a new entry in the session history. This will erase

   12144             :     // Save the current scroll position (bug 590573).

   12318             : nsresult
   12319           1 : nsDocShell::AddToSessionHistory(nsIURI* aURI, nsIChannel* aChannel,

   12359             :     // This is a subframe

   12376           1 :   if (!entry) {
   12377           1 :     entry = do_CreateInstance(NS_SHENTRY_CONTRACTID);
   12378             : 
   12379           1 :     if (!entry) {

   12381             :     }
   12382             :   }
   12383             :

   12882             : void
   12883           1 : nsDocShell::SwapHistoryEntries(nsISHEntry* aOldEntry, nsISHEntry* aNewEntry)

   12902             : nsresult
   12903           1 : nsDocShell::SetChildHistoryEntry(nsISHEntry* aEntry, nsDocShell* aShell,
   12904             :                                  int32_t aEntryIndex, void* aData)

   12906           1 :   SwapEntriesData* data = static_cast<SwapEntriesData*>(aData);

   12972             : void
   12973           1 : nsDocShell::SetHistoryEntry(nsCOMPtr<nsISHEntry>* aPtr, nsISHEntry* aEntry)
   12974             : {
   12975             :   // We need to sync up the docshell and session history trees for
   12976             :   // subframe navigation.  If the load was in a subframe, we forward up to
   12977             :   // the root docshell, which will then recursively sync up all docshells
   12978             :   // to their corresponding entries in the new session history tree.
   12979             :   // If we don't do this, then we can cache a content viewer on the wrong
   12980             :   // cloned entry, and subsequently restore it at the wrong time.
   12981             : 
   12982           1 :   nsISHEntry* newRootEntry = GetRootSHEntry(aEntry);

   12984             :     // newRootEntry is now the new root entry.
   12985             :     // Find the old root entry as well.
   12986             : 
   12987             :     // Need a strong ref. on |oldRootEntry| so it isn't destroyed when
   12988             :     // SetChildHistoryEntry() does SwapHistoryEntries() (bug 304639).

   12991             :       nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem> rootAsItem;
   12992           1 :       GetSameTypeRootTreeItem(getter_AddRefs(rootAsItem));
   12993           1 :       nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> rootShell = do_QueryInterface(rootAsItem);

   12995           1 :         SwapEntriesData data = { this, newRootEntry };

   12997           1 :         nsDocShell* rootDocShell = static_cast<nsDocShell*>(rootIDocShell);

   13000             :         nsresult rv =
   13001             : #endif

   13005             :     }
   13006             :   }
   13007             :

   13009           1 : }

   13217           1 :       visitURIFlags |= IHistory::REDIRECT_SOURCE;

   13222             :     // connection problem.

   13224           1 :              ((aResponseStatus >= 400 && aResponseStatus <= 501) ||

   13961           1 : class OnLinkClickEvent : public Runnable
   13962             : {
   13963             : public:
   13964             :   OnLinkClickEvent(nsDocShell* aHandler, nsIContent* aContent,
   13965             :                    nsIURI* aURI,

   13974           1 :   NS_IMETHOD Run() override
   13975             :   {
   13976           1 :     nsAutoPopupStatePusher popupStatePusher(mPopupState);
   13977             : 
   13978             :     // We need to set up an AutoJSAPI here for the following reason: When we do
   13979             :     // OnLinkClickSync we'll eventually end up in nsGlobalWindow::OpenInternal
   13980             :     // which only does popup blocking if !LegacyIsCallerChromeOrNativeCode().
   13981             :     // So we need to fake things so that we don't look like native code as far
   13982             :     // as LegacyIsCallerNativeCode() is concerned.
   13983           1 :     AutoJSAPI jsapi;
   13984           1 :     if (mIsTrusted || jsapi.Init(mContent->OwnerDoc()->GetScopeObject())) {
   13985             :       mHandler->OnLinkClickSync(mContent, mURI,
   13986             :                                 mTargetSpec.get(), mFileName,
   13987             :                                 mPostDataStream, mHeadersDataStream,
   13988             :                                 mNoOpenerImplied,
   13989           1 :                                 nullptr, nullptr, mTriggeringPrincipal);
   13990             :     }
   13991           1 :     return NS_OK;
   13992             :   }

   14033           1 : nsDocShell::OnLinkClick(nsIContent* aContent,

   14039             :                         bool aIsTrusted,

   14044           1 :   if (!IsNavigationAllowed() || !IsOKToLoadURI(aURI)) {
   14045             :     return NS_OK;
   14046             :   }
   14047             : 
   14048             :   // On history navigation through Back/Forward buttons, don't execute
   14049             :   // automatic JavaScript redirection such as |anchorElement.click()| or
   14050             :   // |formElement.submit()|.

   14055             :     return NS_OK;

   14059             :     return NS_OK;
   14060             :   }

   14089             : NS_IMETHODIMP
   14090           1 : nsDocShell::OnLinkClickSync(nsIContent* aContent,

   14157             :         break;

   14169             :   // the document that the link is in, or the last document that the

   14969             :   }
   14970           0 :   *aResult = static_cast<TabChild*>(tabChild.get())->IsAwaitingLargeAlloc();
